summary: When the Department of Education finds a college engaged in certain kinds of misconduct, such as misrepresenting graduates' job prospects, students may qualify for loan relief. Students can apply through a process known as "borrower defense." If Education finds misconduct, it can forgive outstanding loan balances and refund payments already made. If colleges engaged in misconduct over time and across locations, Education can approve relief...
title: Department of Education: Student Loan Relief in Cases of College Misconduct
